title: Trump's Presidency marks the end of American Christianity.

body: I'm not religious, but I respect religion. I don't know a single person that I'd put forward as a perfect Christian representative. Do you? As a right winger/conservative/etc. I'll back anyone that fights against the left. I'll also call out their imperfections as we all should. I think saying that a person must be a christian to be a person to espouse conservative values is incorrect.
body_html: I'm not religious, but I respect religion. I don't know a single person that I'd put forward as a perfect Christian representative. Do you? As a right winger/conservative/etc. I'll back anyone that fights against the left. I'll also call out their imperfections as we all should. I think saying that a person must be a christian to be a person to espouse conservative values is incorrect.

body:
>I don't know a single person that I'd put forward as a perfect Christian representative. Do you?

Of course not. But there's a fair deal of real estate between "perfect" and "not even remotely trying."

You might as well claim that since there's no such thing as a perfect guitarist, literally anyone could have played lead guitar for Aerosmith.

post.title: Trump's Presidency marks the end of American Christianity.

author.bio: Considering whether to delete my account. Decided to just set my profile private for now.
author.bio_html: Considering whether to delete my account. Decided to just set my profile private for now.

body:
>The lefts biggest complaint is that he wasn’t

I know dozens of people on the left and I have not heard this complaint once.

Trump is clearly not a practicing Christian and doesn't give a single thought to religion in his daily life. And, indeed, he has explicitly rejected many of the basic premises of the religion.

So I guess it's a matter of definition. If someone was born to a Christian and doesn't give religion a single thought and also doesn't bother to declare any particular identity - is that a Christian? An atheist? Both? Neither?
body_html:
The lefts biggest complaint is that he wasn’t

I know dozens of people on the left and I have not heard this complaint once.

Trump is clearly not a practicing Christian and doesn't give a single thought to religion in his daily life. And, indeed, he has explicitly rejected many of the basic premises of the religion.

So I guess it's a matter of definition. If someone was born to a Christian and doesn't give religion a single thought and also doesn't bother to declare any particular identity - is that a Christian? An atheist? Both? Neither?

body: You're spot on, there was never such a thing as a "christian nation", they were all fake. The biggest teller for me is that they are mostly characterized by things they are commanded *not* to do, namely self-righteousness and virtue signaling and being judgemental. I get the feeling most of them are only christian because it's tradition, and indeed, their biggest value is often preserving tradition (another thing christians are not supposed to do). The way they treat the bible is more akin to a myth book than stories that actually happened, I don't get the sense that they actually believe it as much as they feel nostalgic about it. I think there's a reason Jesus said the gate is narrow, any time where the majority conforms to a form of christianity it's a major red flag that something's not right.
body_html: You're spot on, there was never such a thing as a "christian nation", they were all fake. The biggest teller for me is that they are mostly characterized by things they are commanded not to do, namely self-righteousness and virtue signaling and being judgemental. I get the feeling most of them are only christian because it's tradition, and indeed, their biggest value is often preserving tradition (another thing christians are not supposed to do). The way they treat the bible is more akin to a myth book than stories that actually happened, I don't get the sense that they actually believe it as much as they feel nostalgic about it. I think there's a reason Jesus said the gate is narrow, any time where the majority conforms to a form of christianity it's a major red flag that something's not right.
